intro: Oldenlandia ciliicaulis, commonly known as the silky false musk vine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, including South Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a silky texture due to fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
